measured_by: Perceived effects of online access survey
justification: The study assessed changes in beliefs about the effects of online access, including patient empowerment, using a 16-item survey with bidimensional 7-point Likert scales that specifically included items on patients' perceived empowerment.

measured_by: Dutch 'Quick scan digital skills' measurement tool
justification: Digital literacy was assessed using items from the 'Quick scan digital skills' tool, which included questions such as the frequency of app usage to evaluate patients' digital literacy.

Health literacy was measured with selected items from the HSL-EU-Q47 questionnaire that address the ability to access, understand, and use health information, providing a comprehensive assessment of health literacy within a healthcare setting.

measured_by: Perceived effects of online access survey
justification: Beliefs about informed healthcare decision-making were evaluated using the same 16-item survey that recorded changes in participants' expectations regarding how online access would influence their ability to make informed healthcare choices.

measured_by: Perceived effects of online access survey
justification: The perceived impact of online access on the GP-patient relationship was explored through the same 16-item questionnaire, with specific items focusing on affective outcomes and the GP-patient relationship.
